resources.string: Tap to find out more about firmware versions from the foxesscommunity.com website
" where residual is estimated by your installation and may not be accurate. Tap the capacity above to enter a manual value."
Empty/full battery durations are estimates based on calculated capacity, assume that solar conditions and battery charge rates remain constant.

Deducts the Min SOC amount from the battery charge level and percentage. Due to inaccuracies in the way battery levels are measured this may result in occasionally showing a negative amount remaining. A * will be shown when you have this option selected.
FoxESS Cloud data is updated every 5 minutes. Auto attempts to synchronise fetches just after the data feed uploads to minimise server load.
Read from your inverter when you login.
Stats are aggregated by FoxESS into 1 hr, 1 day or 1 month totals
Energy used to charge the battery
Enter your FoxESS Cloud API key
Note that not all parameters contain values
Find out more about these variables
Total solar energy generation predicted by Solcast
Solar / Battery power coming through the inverter
Power being exported back to the grid
Power being consumed from the grid
The AC power flowing into the house load, in kilowatts (kW)
The power from PV string 1, in kilowatts (kW)
The DC voltage being presented by PV string 1, in volts (V)
The DC current flowing through PV string 1, in Amps (A)
The power from PV string 2, in kilowatts (kW)
The DC voltage being presented by PV string 2, in volts (V)
The DC current flowing through PV string 2, in Amps (A)
The power from PV string 3, in kilowatts (kW)
The DC voltage being presented by PV string 3, in volts (V)
The DC current flowing through PV string 3, in Amps (A)
The power from PV string 4, in kilowatts (kW)
The DC voltage being presented by PV string 4, in volts (V)
The DC current flowing through PV string 4, in Amps (A)
Temperature inside the inverter, also known as Inner Temperature, in degrees C
Temperature of the vanes on the back of the inverter, in degrees C
Temperature of the BMS, also known as BMS temperature, in degrees C
The DC current flowing from the battery, measured by the BMS, in amps (A)
The DC battery voltage, measured by the BMS, in volts (V)
The DC battery voltage, measured by the inverter, in volts (V)
The DC current flowing from the battery, measured by inverter, in amps (A)
The power being read by the grid meter or current clamp CT1, in kilowatts (kW)
The reactive power being output by the inverter, in kilovolt-amps reactive (kVAR)
State of Charge for the battery. The percentage of the battery capacity that is available
The power being read by meter 2 or current clamp CT2, in kilowatts (kW)
The ratio of the true power output in kilowatts (kW) to the apparent power output, in kilovolt-amps (kVA)
Assumes if your net consumption is positive then you are self-sufficient.\n\nSufficiency = (export - import + batCharge - batDischarge) / houseUsage
Assumes any amount taken from the grid reduces your self-sufficiency.\n\nSufficiency = grid / houseUsage
Parameters are updated every 5 minutes by FoxESS and only available for a single day at a time. Tap the graph to view data at a specific time.
Your battery will not be force charged from the grid.
. These periods overlap, you may want to update them.
Your battery will be force charged from the grid between %1s.
Your battery will be force charged from the grid between %1s, and %2s.
Start time must be before the end time
The minimum charge the battery should maintain.
The minimum charge the battery should maintain when grid power is present.

For the most part this is the setting that determines when the batteries will stop being used. Setting this higher than Min SoC will reserve battery power for a grid outage. For example, if you set Min SoC to 10% and Min SoC on Grid to 20%, the inverter will stop supplying power from the batteries at 20% and the house load will be supplied from the grid. If there is a grid outage, the batteries could be used (via an EPS switch) to supply emergency power until the battery charge drops to 10%.
If you\'re not sure then set both values the same.

Your batteries will not charge or discharge between %1s and %2s. Solar power will be diverted to charging the battery. Any house load will come from the grid between these times. Reset time periods to disable this.

Your batteries will not charge or discharge between %1s. Solar power will be diverted to charging the battery. Any house load will come from the grid between these times. Reset the time period to disable this.

In this mode, the inverter prioritises power allocation as follows:

1. House Load
2. Battery Charging
3. Export

In this mode, the inverter prioritises power allocation as follows:

1. House Load
2. Export
3. Battery Charging

In this mode, the inverter prioritises power allocation as follows:

1. Battery Charging
2. House Load
3. Export
Find out more about work modes
Only change these values if you know what you are doing
Shows earnings today, this month, this year, and all-time based on a crude calculation of
Touch the graph to see values at that time
Something went wrong fetching data from FoxESS cloud.
Below this amount the sun will be yellow.
Between low and medium the sun will be yellow and glowing.
Between medium and high the sun will be orange and glowing. Above high the sun will be red and glowing.
Tap the icon for further detail
All values are shown as kilowatts. E.g. %1$s, %2$s
All values are shown as watts. E.g. %1$s, %2$s
Values are shown as kilowatts unless under 1 kilowatt when they are shown as watts. E.g. %1$s, %2$s
Approximate income received from exporting energy to the grid.
Approximate expenditure avoided by generating your own solar power.
Approximate total benefit of having your solar/battery installation.
Shows financial estimates for today only on the flow page, and for the selected time period on the stats page.
This unit price is managed on the FoxESS cloud.\n\nShows earnings today, this month, this year, and all -time based on a calculation of feed - in kWh * unit price.
Share or open with another app

Solcast provide solar predictions based on your location. To sign up for free, visit https://solcast.com/free-rooftop-solar-forecasting and register for Hobbyist Access.\n\nOnce you\'ve signed up and have created your site(s) paste your API key below. Your API key can be found at https://toolkit.solcast.com.au by clicking the menu at the top right of the page.
Values will be shown unmodified from the data feed. You may see abnormally large numbers in your usage where the data gets corrupted.
Values above 1,048,575 will be clipped. E.g. a value of 201,539,769 would be shown as 3461.8. Use this if you\'re seeing abnormally large numbers on your graphs.
Values above 104,857 will be clipped. E.g. a value of 45,899.7 would be shown as 24.5. Use this if you\'re seeing abnormally large numbers on your graphs.
Visit the settings tab to configure Solcast

Your inverter schedule settings were saved. Please be aware that your schedule settings will take priority over any battery charge schedule, min SOC and inverter work mode you had previously configured.
You have no time periods defined. Add a time period to define how you\'d like your inverter to behave during specific hours.
The minimum battery state of charge. This must be at most the Force Discharge SOC value.
When the battery reaches this level, discharging will stop. If you wanted to save some battery power for later, perhaps set it to 50%.

The output power level to be delivered, including your house load and grid export. E.g. If you have 5kW inverter then set this to 5000, then if the house load is 750W the other 4.25kW will be exported.
Please enter a number between 10 and 100
Min SoC must be less than or equal to Force Discharge SoC
End time must be after start time
Could not load forecast - You have exceeded your free daily limit
Calculated as a Riemann sum approximation integration of pvPower. This will be reasonably accurate but is only calculated for today.
Uses the FoxESS supplied value which contains battery and solar output.

We encountered an error while fetching your battery settings from Fox Cloud, which might be due to a temporary issue with the Fox servers. As a result, some battery-related features might not work as expected.\n\nDon\'t worry, though – once you restart the app, we\'ll try to retrieve your settings again. Thanks for your patience.
Schedules are not supported on your %1s with the firmware version you have v%2s.
Includes data from %1$s to %2$s. Figures are approximate and assume the buy/sell energy prices remained constant throughout the period of ownership.
Schedule templates are not yet available via OpenAPI from FoxESS. They have been requested and will be added when available.
Click the User Profile menu option
Copy the API key (make a note of it securely)
An API key is like a single additional password for your account that you can give to non-Fox apps (like Energy Stats!) which they can use to access your account.
If you want to stop apps from accessing your account you can regenerate your API key. Anything using the old key will immediately be denied access.
Your API key will be 36 characters long and look something like abcde123\-4567\-8901\-2345\-6789abcdef01.
Please ensure the system date/time on your phone is set to \'automatic\' otherwise you may be unable to login with your API key.
The FoxESS website may have issues on mobile devices. If you experience any problems retrieving your API key, please reach out to service.uk@fox-ess.com for assistance.
If you have multiple inverters and your PV generation values are incorrect try adjusting these settings.
Your API token is invalid. Please logout and follow the instructions to generate a new API token.
Your API token is invalid. Please follow the instructions to generate a new API token.
Please ensure the system date/time on your phone is set to \'automatic\' otherwise you may be unable to login with your API key.
No self sufficiency will be shown.
Force Discharge power needs to be greater than 0 to discharge
Drag the slider above to see how your solar flow will display when generating different levels of power.

The FoxESS OpenAPI failed to respond quickly enough. Please try again or raise an issue with FoxESS about their OpenAPI performance at https://www.foxesscloud.com/bus/workorder/list if you often see this.
Schedule Templates are local to your device and will not be visible on Fox Cloud. This is a limitation imposed by FoxESS. They will not be removed if you log out.
Your inverter state is reported as being
No reason was given. Check the front screen of your inverter.
Some settings will only take effect on the next data refresh

Similar to Self Use, except the battery is not discharged.
Charges the battery from the grid

Show self sufficiency percentage on stats graph

All battery temperatures will be displayed.
Only the temperature of battery stack %1$s will be displayed (e.g H3 Pro). If not found, no battery temperature will be displayed.
If you’ve recently updated your WiFi settings and need help reconnecting your inverter, click below to watch a step-by-step video tutorial.
You can also find this video link in the Settings FAQ section

Fox Cloud error 44098. Could not save schedule. This may be because your inverter firmware expects a MaxSOC value, but Fox do not yet support MaxSOC on their OpenAPI system which is used by Energy Stats. You will need to use FoxCloud 2.0 to manage your schedules for now.

Your Solcast predictions are fetched when Energy Stats loads (at most once every 8 hours). Add the \'Solcast solar prediction\' parameter on the parameters graph variable selector. Since Solcast only provides future data, you must have opened the app yesterday to view today’s prediction.
Fetch solar forecast on app launch
